cves.description: MCPJam inspector is the local-first development platform for MCP servers. Versions 1.4.2 and earlier are vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, which allows an attacker to send a crafted HTTP request that triggers the installation of an MCP server, leading to RCE. Since MCPJam inspector by default listens on 0.0.0.0 instead of 127.0.0.1, an attacker can trigger the RCE remotely via a simple HTTP request. Version 1.4.3 contains a patch.
problemType: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function

cves.description: BOOTP Turbo 2.0.0.1253 contains an unquoted service path vulnerability in its Windows service configuration. Attackers can exploit the unquoted path to execute arbitrary code with elevated LocalSystem privileges during system startup or reboot.
Incorrect privilege assignment in Windows Hello allows an unauthorized attacker to perform tampering locally.

iDailyDiary 4.30 contains a denial of service vulnerability that allows attackers to crash the application by overflowing the preferences tab name field. Attackers can paste a 2,000,000 character buffer into the default diary tab name to trigger an application crash.
problemType: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input

cves.description: Improper verification of cryptographic signature in Windows Admin Center allows an authorized attacker to elevate privileges locally.

affected.product: Windows Admin Center in Azure Portal

problemType: CWE-347: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature

cves.description: Improper access control in Windows Deployment Services allows an unauthorized attacker to execute code over an adjacent network.

affected.product: Windows Server 2008 Service Pack 2 (Server Core installation)
Windows Server 2008 R2 Service Pack 1 (Server Core installation)

cves.description: Missing authentication for critical function in SQL Server allows an authorized attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

affected.product: Microsoft SQL Server 2025 for x64-based Systems (GDR)
Microsoft SQL Server 2022 for x64-based Systems (CU 22)

problemType: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function

cves.description: Concurrent execution using shared resource with improper synchronization ('race condition') in Printer Association Object allows an authorized attacker to elevate privileges locally.
problemType: CWE-362: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')

cves.description:
Windows Secure Boot stores Microsoft certificates in the UEFI KEK and DB. These original certificates are approaching expiration, and devices containing affected certificate versions must update them to maintain Secure Boot functionality and avoid compromising security by losing security fixes related to Windows boot manager or Secure Boot.
The operating system’s certificate update protection mechanism relies on firmware components that might contain defects, which can cause certificate trust updates to fail or behave unpredictably. This leads to potential disruption of the Secure Boot trust chain and requires careful validation and deployment to restore intended security guarantees.



Certificate Authority (CA)
Location
Purpose
Expiration Date




Microsoft Corporation KEK CA 2011
KEK
Signs updates to the DB and DBX
06/24/2026


Microsoft Corporation UEFI CA 2011
DB
Signs 3rd party boot loaders, Option ROMs, etc.
06/27/2026


Microsoft Windows Production PCA 2011
DB
Signs the Windows Boot Manager
10/19/2026



For more information see this CVE and Windows Secure Boot certificate expiration and CA updates.
problemType: CWE-1329 - Reliance on Component That is Not Updateable

cves.description: Exposure of sensitive information to an unauthorized actor in Desktop Windows Manager allows an authorized attacker to disclose information locally.
problemType: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

cves.description: CakePHP is a rapid development framework for PHP. The PaginatorHelper::limitControl() method has a cross-site-scripting vulnerability via query string parameter manipulation. This issue has been fixed in 5.2.12 and 5.3.1.
problemType: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

cves.description: Use of uninitialized resource in Dynamic Root of Trust for Measurement (DRTM) allows an authorized attacker to disclose information locally.
Cross site scripting vulnerability in seeyon Zhiyuan A8+ Collaborative Management Software 7.0 via the topValue parameter to the seeyon/main.do endpoint.
